official_title: To establish domestic content requirements for motor vehicles sold or distributed in interstate commerce in the United States.
short_title: Fair Practices in Automotives Products Act

summary.text: Fair Practices in Automotive Products Act - Sets forth automotive minimum domestic content ratios for model years beginning with 1991. Directs the Secretary of Transportation to set rules for allocating automotive products among manufacturers. Requires specified manufacturers beginning with the 1990 model year to maintain automotive product records. Directs the Secretary to make domestic content information available to the public beginning with the 1991 model year. Makes it unlawful for a manufacturer to fail to meet applicable domestic content requirements. Sets forth administrative and civil measures for such failure and for related violations. Directs the Secretary and the Federal Trade Commission jointly to undertake a study of, and report to the Congress regarding, discriminatory practices which motor vehicle manufacturers use to persuade dealers to favor foreign made automotive parts over domestically-produced parts.
